description:
gTech’s Product and Tools Operations team (gPTO) leverages deep user, operational, and technical insights to innovate Google's Ads products into customer experiences that are so intuitive (or automated) that they require no support at all. gPTO partners closely with gTech’s Support, Professional Services, Product Management, and Engineering teams to innovate and simplify our Ads products and build the productivity tools ecosystem for gTech users.

Our goal is to make our customers more successful by creating relevant, useful, up-to-date information, and making sure it’s available—whenever and wherever they might need it.

As a Content Strategist, you’ll be working cross-functionally with product operations managers, vendors, product managers, and UX teams. You'll also manage feedback from multiple stakeholders, and keep our customers’ needs at the top of your mind.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience working in an editorial, content strategy, or technical writing capacity.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience creating online help documentation or training materials for an external audience.
  • Project management experience and the ability to execute end-to-end solutions.
  • Knowledge of Google Ads and related ads products.
  • Understanding of Google’s support ecosystem and industry landscape.
  • Effective collaboration skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Increase the efficiency of self-help for users by improving external Google Ads documentation.
  • Work with product, marketing, legal, and UX teams to understand products and make them more accessible to users.
  • Oversee content strategy for select product areas.
  • Direct vendor writers to create documentation for users.
  • Collect, prioritize, and address knowledge feedback.
title: Content Strategist, Ads Help Center, Product and Tools Operations
